clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Technology and Telemedicine to Improve Quality of Care in COVID 19 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Technology and Telemedicine to Improve Quality of Care in COVID 19 Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the use of technology including remote vital sign monitoring in improving quality of patient care, decreasing hospital admissions and re-admissions, decreasing hospital length of stay and decreasing use of personal protective equipment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months (average expected time on study: 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants requiring initial hospital admission for COVID-19 during the study (outpatient groups only)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months (average expected time on study: 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants requiring hospital re-admission for COVID-19 during the study (all groups)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once after completion of device use (up to 15 minutes to complete the survey)
primary_outcome.description: Five questions related to satisfaction with experience using home pulse oximetry, each on a scale of 1 (poor) to 5 (excellent) summed and averaged for an overall range of 1 to 5 (higher scores = better experience).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once after completion of device use (up to 15 minutes to complete the survey)
primary_outcome.description: Four questions related to satisfaction with experience using home pulse oximetry, each on a scale of 1 (poor) to 5 (excellent) summed and averaged for an overall range of 1 to 4 (higher scores = better experience).
Level of personal protective improvement in an in-patient setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of in-patient encounters with COVID patients as a measure of provider exposure to high risk illness

arm_group.description: Patients that are admitted to the hospital with COVID 19.
Patients that are persons under investigation for COVID 19 or diagnosed COVID 19 patients that are not ill enough to be hospitalized.
Patients that are being discharged from the hospital with a diagnosis of COVID 19.
Patients that are persons under investigation for COVID 19 or diagnosed COVID 19 patients that are not ill enough to be hospitalized

intervention.description: Participants will use the Doctorgram Patient Kit for remote monitoring. The kit includes remote use stethoscope, pulse oximeter, peak flow monitor, EKG monitor, blood pressure monitor.
Participants will use the Doctorgram mobile application to enable remote monitoring with Doctorgram Patient Kit.
Participants will use a remote pulse oximeter for monitoring oxygen saturation at home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized patient with COVID 19 or outpatient under investigation for or diagnosed with COVID 19
- Patient has the ability to be trained in utilization of remote monitoring equipment
- Patient agrees for outpatient follow up with the Crown Clinic
- For the telemedicine kits-patient has a device that is compatible with the use of the Doctorgram application
- For the pulse oximetry study-Patient is stable for discharge from the hospital. For outpatients, patient does not require hospitalization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under the age of 18
- Pregnancy
